Posts.Content: I still have pain and numbness four weeks on from having mastectomy and the nodes removed.  Was on strong painkillers but then the doctor prescribed nerve pain tablets.  Just keep doing the exercises it will get easier x
Posts.Title: pain and numbness after op

Posts.Content: It's understandable to have a meltdown I was more worried about the surgery than having the chemotherapy.  Now tables are turned and six weeks post mastectomy I am afraid to do anything in case of picking up an infection one week post chemotherapy.  I am having a real tough day today very tearful and just led on the sofa not wanting to do anything.  Hopefully it gets easier with time. Becky x
Posts.Title: Having a meltdown

Posts.Content: Pam263 Hi Becky - at the moment I feel incredibly lucky as my consultant says I don't need chemo or radiotherapy- just a mastectomy.  When I read all the treatment other ladies are going through I feel I'm being a total whimp worrying about paper knickers just because I'm super big!  I do hope you start to feel better soon  luv n hugs  Pam xx Believe me Pam you are not a wimp.  We are all in the same boat as far as I am concerned no matter what treatment we are all receiving.  I was okay I just wore my own knickers no one said any different I would be worried about paper ones as well.  Good luck with everything it won't be as bad and you will look back on it and hopefully have a good laugh about it. Becky xx
Posts.Title: Having a meltdown

Posts.Content: OMG thought it was just me lol.  Been having these at night since first FEC not going through menopause yet although not had a period so far this year . Does this ever stop because it's affecting my sleep.
Posts.Title: Feeling hot and cold at night

Posts.Content: Yeah still in quite a bit of pain and taking dihydrocodiene and paracetamol.  Would rather not take painkillers though.
Posts.Title: Tens machine

Posts.Content: Anyone used a tens machine to help with the pain?
Posts.Title: Tens machine

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone xxx
Posts.Title: Having chemo and herceptin

Posts.Content: Ask your BCN about the nerve pain my doctor prescribed Garbapentin which has helped quite a lot.  Six weeks on and I still have problems with my arm
Posts.Title: had left sided masectomy last week, so sad today

Posts.Content: StormyLovesOdd Myleft sided masectomy was a week today and I thought I was coping OK but today I've just felt like crying all say.  I'm a double H on the right side and nothing on the left and it's just so obvious.  I can't even wear my bra because it's just too painful under my arm, so I can't wear my softie.  I dont have the confidence to leave the house anymore,, even with my coat on you can see how lopsided I am.  I was going to take my dog to the park today but I chickened out, loosing my hair to the chemo and facing the stares of strangers are bad enough but this is even worse, my surgeon has told me I won't be able to have a reconstruction for at least a year, how on earth am I going to manage.   Please tell me it gets better.   I had left side mastectomy and complete node clearance six weeks ago for me it's not too noticeable as small but still having trouble looking at myself in the mirror it's very hard some days but hopefully it will get easier.  Take care.
Posts.Title: had left sided masectomy last week, so sad today

Posts.Content: Right seen surgeon today all is well and healing fine. He said will be having normal chemo and also herceptin.  Is this both together forgot to ask him.  Seeing oncologist next Friday to discuss treatment.  Is it worth getting a picc line and does this hurt ?
Posts.Title: Having chemo and herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I am starting the chemotherapy on Tuesday after seeing Oncologist today.  FECT is being used for six three weekly sessions.  The only thing I am really worried about is losing my fingernails and toenails how common is this?
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Dreamthief Morning scotland13  Have you gathered up any other helpful chemo aid items for Tuesday or are you still going through your pre-chemo shopping list ? There are some items that would be a lot more useful than others. G n' J To be held honest haven't thought of any other items that I would need for Tuesday any help would be appreciated x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Dreamthief Hi scotland13  There is quite a list here you can pick through. Some are more of more value than others. Personally I would go for a mouthwash that contains Chlorhexidine, soft toothbrush, digital thermometer (to check if your temp goes up to 37.5) , something for Constipation and Diarrhoea as you could get either and one can quickly turn to the other. Ginger Nut and Arrowroot biscuits to help with any nausea and taste issues and if you haven't got a PICC line fitted one of those microwaveable lavender wheat wraps (Tesco or Amazon etc) to help with any vein aches. Hope this helps, G n' J Thankyou so much x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Dreamthief Morning scotland13  Have you gathered up any other helpful chemo aid items for Tuesday or are you still going through your pre-chemo shopping list ? Ginger Nut and Arrowroot biscuits to help with any nausea and taste issues and if you haven't got a PICC line fitted one of those microwaveable lavender wheat wraps (Tesco or Amazon etc) to help with any vein aches. Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I am starting the chemotherapy on Tuesday after seeing Oncologist today.  FECT is being used for six three weekly sessions.  The only thing I am really worried about is losing my fingernails and toenails how common is this?
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: I am only having three docetaxal sessions.  Just ordering some Sally Hansen nail hardener now.  Starting to feel quite a bit anxious about it all now
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: Crystaljuju FEC will more than likely make you feel sick. Put the nail hardener on the back burner until docetaxol.  things you might need: A thermometer to take your temp Bottled water if you don't do tap. Aim for over 2 litres per day ice lollies helps with nausea  crackers/ginger biscuits for nausea Take the anti sickness regularly don't wait until you feel sick. Eat little and often. I was in bed for three days after each Fec but then recovered. Sleeping it off is the best way if you can.  Your chemo unit should be helpful too so don't hold back with the questions.  Julia X  Many thanks x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Sleeping it off is the best way if you can.  Your chemo unit should be helpful too so don't hold back with the questions.  Julia X  Many thanks x

Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: bonbonlarue It is normal to be worried about the unknown and chemo is not always fun but you will get lots of support, plenty of meds to help deal with side effects and very often a successful outcome. Do you know which chemo you will be having? There is always someone here who has gone through it and can help you  x Bon Having FEC-t six sessions plus Herceptin the radiotherapy and hormone therapy
Posts.Title: Having a wobble

Posts.Content: Was supposed to start my chemotherapy last Tuesday but had an infection.  Now going to be this Tuesday but I am having doubts about going through with it.  Had left mastectomy with full node clearance is this normal to feel like this.  Have constantly been in tears since yesterday.
Posts.Title: Having a wobble

Posts.Content: JJsailor Hi Yep all quite normal, also if have already had op then you will already be a bit low. Go forward with inner strength and resolve. You CAN do this, one step at a time and with the help and love of us all Good luck and hang on in there xx Thankyou
Posts.Title: Having a wobble

Posts.Content: I had left mastectomy two weeks ago with axillary clearance.  I was a mess all over the place not worried about operation so much just about the pain.  Got dressings off today and cried but it will heal properly eventually.  It all takes time.  I had a heart cushion given to me in the hospital which does help with your arm.  The BCN should also give you a mastectomy bra with a special foam pad after your operation.  Anyway best of luck and bear on ministries forum is a God send xxx

Posts.Content: Is there anything you can do beforehand to stop them falling off.
